Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory20.jpg'}
{3: 'A few minutes later, a massive fireball with a long and fiery tail falls near Nikola from the sky.'}
{3: 'It slows. The large, grid-like main cabin with the Star of Life Medical logo on its side could be seen from the ground.'}
{3: 'The rubble crumbles from the thrust produced by the engine.'}
{3: 'Eventually, it landed on the center of an open space steadily.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Deploying an airdrop of all-terrain field hospital for one Construct only...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Nikola', 3: "It's necessary as it's an emergency and a special case.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The Science Council and Star of Life are in the same boat with you now.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "No need to worry about the law issues, I'll explain to the council.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Is there something to do with your relationship with President Hassen?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "No, I'm just good at dealing with troublesome works... like this.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "Anyway, we should play our own parts. When it comes to the future of humans, we shouldn't have any hesitation...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Now get prepared for the remote surgery.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Frankly speaking, we're only able to simulate the human consciousness even with the technology of M.I.N.D.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'You should know that direct operation towards consciousness is way more complicated than general surgery, right?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "Of course, otherwise I wouldn't let you, the only person who has acquired this skill in the whole Babylonia, lead this operation.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The analysis of consciousness has been completed. We will make a proposal regarding the process of memory...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "That's our new pride of Babylonia.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "I'm just trying to end the whole thing as soon as possible...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Then I should tell you the truth.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'The past experience has caused ineffaceable impacts on her.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Then I have to tell you that part of her consciousness is in a state of high entropy, which is kind of chaotic, and very... persistent.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "That's why I need her... to stay loyal to humanity.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'In short, you want to erase her memory...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Only if necessary.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Then I have to tell you that part of her consciousness is in a state of high-entropy, which is kind of chaotic, and very... persistent.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Even if I can deal with it, our connection is insufficient to meet the requirement of such a high-precision transfer.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'If we insist to extract her memory, I cannot undertake the consequences.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "Then what's your plan?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'I think we better save that part of memory in the form of subconsciousness.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "If we can prevent it from being awakened, we'll be able to keep the integrity of her personality so that it won't be affected by that part of her memory.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'However, we cannot promise whether deviation will occur with time or not even if we adopt the more conservative plan.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'I just need her will to be strong enough to last until the end of the war, as for the deviation...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "In this case, I'll carry out a branch operation on her consciousness, and make a copy of it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Wait, as I remember, your principle is to retain the uniqueness of consciousness, right?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Yes, and it's the only way to guarantee...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'You... become astonishingly obsessive when it comes to protecting the consciousness of the Construct...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'I thought it was quite common for you to deal with cases like that when doing scientific researches.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "Hmph, I'm quite surprised that you're such a compassionate person, seeing that you usually treat the Constructs as your objects of study.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Don't overthink it. As a scientific researcher, I need a copy of her main personality as a control, that's all.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "It's up to you... In fact, we only need to ensure there's only one active consciousness at the same time.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Alright, I would rather listen to the advice from a professionalâ€”Is that okay?', 4: '2'}
